comments:
can't connect to msn with an email address not ended with "@hotmail.com".

i have this log :

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-07-03 16:35:05.058
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Container connect".
!STACK 0
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1
	at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1938)
	at org.eclipse.ecf.internal.provider.msn.MSNID.<init>(MSNID.java:33)
	at org.eclipse.ecf.internal.provider.msn.MSNNamespace.createInstance(MSNNamespace.java:26)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

more details about my conf :

i use europa with a JDK1.6_01 under WindowsXP
Wait, so you have an abc@hotmail.com, and you're trying to connect with just specifying 'abc'?
doesn't work too with a jdk1.5.0_09

no i have a valid email address like "somebody@somewhere.com" and i type it completely.
it is not a "ui" bug (i am not talking about someone who just wrote "somebody" instead of "somebody@hotmail.com") it is another bug.
So you mean your MSN account that is from hotmail.com works but your other account from otherdomain.com doesn't?
Wait, never mind. I see the problem now. For some reason, one of the parsing of one of your contact's email addresses is not being processed properly.
it my be linked with some non-ascii character in one of my buddies nick name...

(In reply to comment #7)
> it my be linked with some non-ascii character in one of my buddies nick name...

No, the user name shouldn't be an issue. In the scenario in question, the email being parsed could not find an '@' symbol. Which I guess may have been what you were referring to in your comment #0 about an email address that doesn't end with "@hotmail.com".

(In reply to comment #8)
> the email being parsed could not find an '@' symbol. 
the email of one of my contacts?
i checked my list : there are contacts email with "_" other contacts with "-" and some with uppercase letters.
I also have  "non MSN contacts" displayed in my Windows Live Messenger contact list. I deleted them from Windows Live Messenger and tried again :
now i show in Progress view 1 task staying forever : "Container connect - connecting to 'somebody@somewhere.com'" . I can't cancel it and to remove it i must quit my Eclipse. In the status bar i can see "Container connect: (30%)"
At this point i have nothing new in the ".log"

Is this same as bug 200489 ?

The stack traces look similar, but not identical.

Remy, is there something to actually fix with these two bugs, or is it some strange behavior associated with login identifiers that do not end in '@hotmail.com'...i.e. comment 8

(In reply to comment #11)
> Is this same as bug 200489 ?

No, I do not believe that these two are the same.

> Remy, is there something to actually fix with these two bugs, or is it some
> strange behavior associated with login identifiers that do not end in
> '@hotmail.com'...i.e. comment 8

I think the issue is with the Yahoo contacts that Nicolas has.

Nicolas, the 30% hanging issue may be related to 196812. Can you try connecting with your Yahoo contacts removed with the 1.0.2 maintenance release?

(In reply to comment #12)
